Package chess

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
This abstract class is the parent class to all the other pieces. It allows us to execute some common functionality. It has two abstract methods, copy and generateValidMoves, along with the move, danger, flag, shield, and toString methods.
Author:
Natalia Bryzhatenko nb631, Christopher Taglieri cat197

    Defines whether the Piece has a valid and legal move that it can make.
    (package private) int[] kingShield
    Defines whether the piece is protecting its King from check.

    Defines the type of Piece that it is initialized to.

    Defines an array that each Piece has that corresponds to all the valid moves it can make on the board.

    Defines and statically tracks the location of the Pieces that have the White King in check.

    Defines the x Position of the Piece.
    (package private) int yPos
    Defines the y Position of the Piece.

      Defines color of the Piece.

      Defines the x Position of the Piece.

      Defines the y Position of the Piece.

      char type
      Defines the type of Piece that it is initialized to.

    • hasValidMove

      boolean hasValidMove
      Defines whether the Piece has a valid and legal move that it can make.

    • hasMoved

      boolean hasMoved
      Defines whether the Piece has moved this game.

    • validMoves

      int[][] validMoves
      Defines an array that each Piece has that corresponds to all the valid moves it can make on the board. Some pieces designate greater values than 1 to denote special moves.

    • kingShield

      int[] kingShield
      Defines whether the piece is protecting its King from check.

    • wKingIsInDanger

      static int[] wKingIsInDanger
      Defines and statically tracks the location of the Pieces that have the White King in check.

    • bKingIsInDanger

      static int[] bKingIsInDanger
      Defines and statically tracks the location of the Pieces that have the Black King in check.

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece​(int color, char type, int xPos, int yPos)
      Initializes an instance of the Piece, though since Piece is an abstract class we never directly have any instances of Piece.
      Parameters:
      color - Color
      type - Type
      xPos - X Position
      yPos - Y Position

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public abstract Piece copy()
      Abstract method that is implemented in subclasses. Allows us to duplicate a Piece without altering the original.
      Returns:
      A Copied Piece.

    • generateValidMoves

      public abstract void generateValidMoves​(Piece[][] board)
      Abstract method that is implemented in the subclasses. Allows generate the valid moves of each piece on the board. Each sub Piece has its own logic that governs this process.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board with all current available pieces located on it.

    • move

      public boolean move​(Piece[][] board, int x, int y, int color)
      A general move method that handles most pieces just fine. Some subclasses will override for their special functionality.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board with all current available pieces located on it.
      x - The x position on the board you wish to move to on your turn;
      y - The y position on the board you wish to move to on your turn;
      color - The color that is attempting to move, ensures strict order is adhered to in chess.
      Returns:
      True if move is valid and no parameters are wrong, False if something prevents the move from legally occurring.

    • danger

      public int[] danger​(int color)
      Makes a copy of our static variable dependent on the color seeking it.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the piece requesting a copy.
      Returns:
      An array that is made up of the location of potential dangers to the king.

    • flag

      public void flag()
      Flag method that populates the potential dangers to the King if called from an opponent piece having a valid move on the King.

    • shield

      public void shield​(Piece[][] board, int x, int y, int deltaX, int deltaY)
      Designates the location of the attacker that the piece is shielding the King from.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board with all current available pieces located on it.
      x - The initial x position of the shielding Piece.
      y - The initial y position of the shielding Piece.
      deltaX - How much that piece changes in the x direction on its path.
      deltaY - How much that piece changes in the y direction on its path.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Simple toString implementation so that Piece appears on board.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
